reviewText: What a fantastic and fun mini-series(!)  This is KITH in top form!!!  I recommend this to anyone interested in an interesting and entertaining little story.  I appreciate that all 5 original KIDS take part!!  Again . . . I recommend this!  I sincerely think they've still got it (even after America's influence on all of their careers.)  Time well spent, money well spent!!  Thanks - pick this up.  As well, it was delivered in 'new' condition and in prompt timing!!
summary: KidsInTheHall will never grow up-or let me - WORD!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Absolutely love this group!! And if you feel the same you will love this mini-series! Great characters and your typical Kids In The Hall comedy about having fun with risky topics(SMALL SMALL SPOILER-I felt evil laughing hysterically at the love between the dead guy and his gay lover, but the script and Scott Thompson pulled it off perfectly. Kind of like their cancer-boy character from before...disturbing but can't stop laughing).It's great seeing the group back and as good as they've always been. If you like their past...bizarre characters, dramatic acting even though it's a comedy, and a intelligent story and script that always makes you ask how that did that scene without cracking up, this show is for you.Now...WE NEED ANOTHER FEATURE FILM!!
summary: These guys could make anything funny!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Kids haven't lost a step.  This is bizarre and hilarious like all of their classic output.  Each member shines in multiple rolls.  I laughed quite hard through most of it.

reviewText: I never watched any of the Kids In The Hall before seeing this on CBC, and I loved it! I am looking forward to sitting down and watching it all over again.

reviewText: KITH are one of the best things i have ever experienced on tv, this series, not so much, BUT it's not horrible either. This isn't anything i would watch over and over again like i do with the series, Brain Candy and the live shows.
